lesson.title: Data Streaming Nanodegree Program Introduction
lesson.summary: You are starting a challenging but rewarding journey! Take a few minutes to read how to get help with projects and content.

concepts.title: Welcome to the Nanodegree Program Experience

atoms.title: Welcome To Your Nanodegree Experience V2

atoms.text:
# Prerequisites
## Before you begin, please check the following Nanodegree Program prerequisite requirements to make sure you have the skills to succeed in this program.

### **To succeed in this program, you should have _intermediate or advanced skills_ in the following languages and tools:**

---- 

#### In **Python**,  you need to have __intermediate skills__  and should be able to do the following to pass the projects:
* ##### Define functions
* ##### Use loops and conditional statements
* ##### Write and use classes in your functions
* ##### Work with various data structures
* ##### Use data-related libraries, like NumPy and Pandas for ETL purposes 
* ##### Read and parse CSV and JSON file formats


#### In **SQL**, you should be able to do the following:
* ##### Perform SQL data cleaning
* ##### Write advanced SQL join functions
* ##### Aggregate data
* ##### Write subqueries
* ##### Write SQL Window Functions

#### In the **Command Line**, you should be able to:
* ##### Navigate through folders and files
* ##### Run scripts from the command line
* ##### Install packages

### Additional Resources
You can find the following courses in the extracurricular section,  if you would like to brush up on the above skills.
* Intro to Python 
* SQL for Data Analysis
* Command Line Essentials

#### All of these courses are available in the [Programming for Data Science Nanodegree Program](https://www.udacity.com/course/programming-for-data-science-nanodegree--nd104) and in our free course catalog. 

### **To succeed in this program, we advise basic familiarity with traditional data batch processing and basic conceptual familiarity with traditional service architectures but these are not required.

Ben Goldberg is our Instructor for the Data Ingestion with Kafka and Kafka Streaming course. In his career as an engineer, Ben has worked in fields ranging from Computer Vision to Natural Language Processing. At SpotHero, he founded and built out their Data Engineering team, using Airflow as one of the key technologies. Ben has also taught a course in our Data Engineering Nanodegree program as well!

Jillian Kim teaches our Spark Streaming course for this program. Jillian is a Senior Data Engineer at Change Healthcare where she has worked in roles from building data analytics platforms to machine learning pipelines. Previously, she was a research engineer at Samsung focused on data analytics and ML, and now leads building pipelines at scale as a Senior Data Engineer at Change Healthcare.

David Drummond is the VP of Engineering at Insight where he enjoys breaking down difficult concepts and helping others learn data engineering. David has a PhD in Physics from UC Riverside. David and Judit (bio below) have also helped build our Data Scientist Nanodegree program!

Judit Lantos is a Senior Data Engineer at Netflix. Formerly she was a Data Engineer at Split, where she worked on the statistical engine of their full-stake experimentation platform, she has also been an instructor at Insight Data Science, helping software engineers and academic coders transition to DE roles. Judit has helped build content for our Data Scientist Nanodegree program!
